website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you have moderate printing needs and occasional copying and scanning to do.
pros: Holds a half ream of paper
Allows you to scan and copy
Wireless works great once you get it set up
cons: Many users turn off the deep sleep mode to get it to work properly

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY thing that I do not like about it is the ink
customer_reviews.text: Live this printer. The ONLY thing that I do not like about it is the ink. You can only use brother because the cartridges have a microchip on them. So you cannot use the cheaper refills.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda S

customer_reviews.title: Just like the old model
customer_reviews.text: Just like the old model. Setup was easy. I just used the drivers from the Brother website. It was plug and play though. Basic drivers auto installed on Windows 10 machine. Setup WIFI printing and was immediately able to print from my macbook pro directly to it. For $140, it is still the best laser jet in the $100 to $200 range.
customer_reviews.author: Troy F.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot copy or scan double sided using the ADF
customer_reviews.text: This is yet another multifunction device by Brother that you cannot use the automatic document feeder to scan or copy double sided documents. This limitation is not listed in the product description either. Most other manufacturers products are able to perform this action. Other than that, if you scan single sided documents often and do the same copying, this device is decent for the cost. This device is very compact compared to those from other manufacturers. I also own a color laser from Brother which is very compact and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason DC

customer_reviews.title: Constantly goes into self diagnostic - delays printing 20 minutes, nothing you can do
customer_reviews.text: As far as the print quality and time- this laser printer is great. It satisfied the need of printing quickly, both sides, and scanning with the feeder. However, I rarely get to use the printer because just about every time I turn it on it goes into a self diagnostic. There's no way to cancel this action. you can unplug it and plug it back in and it just starts the self diagnostic over. I've only printed maybe 30 pages with this printer over the course of a couple months, and just about every time I've printed it has done this to me. Canon recently came out with a laser printer that I wish I would have gotten instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this a couple months. I debated over the sheet feeder for making copies. It was $30.00 more. Glad we bought this model with the sheet feeder Easy setup and works like a charm. Our HP all in one was killing us on the cost of ink. If the color ran out you couldnt print in black, even if the black cartridge was full. There was a bunch of other ways HP seems to drive up the price of consumables up. No more HP printers for me. I think Brother makes good products. I have a sewing machine by them and i love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Cid Herman

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY GREAT PRINTER!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this from seeing the negative comments about running it with mac/ios. I have not had any problems and set up was a breeze. I homeschool and use this printer daily for activities and worksheets. My kids are able to color with markers and watercolors and not have the black lines bleed as they do with inkjet. I don't know what took me so long to get a laser printer. Never again will I buy an inset. I am still printing from the "sample" toner that came with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: MommaCass

customer_reviews.title: Affordable print and scan
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up on WiFi and USB cable. WiFi print/scan works well. Windows driver and admin app works great. Have not used the included toner up so I can not comment on the life of the toner cartridge. Managed to get working on Arch linux but had to manually find and install the drivers before setting the device up. Printing works well over WiFi and scanning over WiFi works well using SANE. Happy to state this machine works well on Arch linux. Duplex printing works great. Scanner feed is only one sided and does not scan duplex. Duplex scan feeder is the only thing missing on this machine
customer_reviews.author: Dehu Guy

customer_reviews.title: Has some annoying issues
customer_reviews.text: Have this for approx a month. Dont use it too often and in 4 weeks after receiving it already I needed to replace the toner which is expensive. Also when printing or copying it constantly states no paper and won't print with full paper in there. You have to play around with the paper then it will work...hit and miss. Print quality good, scanner works fine. Again ...really annoyed I had to replace the toner ridiculously fast after receiving printer. ALSO BROTHER CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE, NEVER ANSWER AFTER HANGING ON NUMEROUS TIMES FOR ALMOST AN HOUR. THE WORST.
customer_reviews.author: CAROLYN

customer_reviews.title: No muss, no fuss with USB-CAT5 cables
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laser printer for less than I paid for toner cartridges for my old 25-year-old Canon copier, which is now history. I connected my Mac running Mavericks to the printer with a 20-foot USB-CAT5 adapter arrangement, and it works very well. I did not try to use the wireless connection, as in the past I have found any wireless arrangement to be problematical at best. By using the cable arrangement, I was able to use the built-in Image Capture app on my Mac to control all the print or scan functions I need, so I did not load or use the apps that came on the Brother installation CD.
customer_reviews.author: Doctorjet

customer_reviews.title: bAD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I HATE THIS PRINTER!!! Every time, not once in a while but every time I go to print, the printer is offline. when I run the diagnostic, it states that there is nothing wrong with the printer and gives me all of this stuff to do to possibly help. If I wanted to fic my own printer I would have applied for the job. I have re-installed as requested and still it has the same issue. This product belongs in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: snowp

customer_reviews.title: Best in Laser printer category
customer_reviews.text: All in One Printer/Scanner/Copier that is perfect for home use. Seamlessly makes printing, scanning, and copying if you are on same network. New software from Brother is elevating product experience to the next level. I mainly use this printer to digitize (Scan) my tons of documents, feeder is awesome & it makes job way easier. I had HP OfficeJet Pro 6975 (same category but INK Jet) but it was making to much noice while doing any activity. This printer is relatively easy going for newbies and low noice level. Brother has done remarkable job for laser printer - Its been appx 6 Months and i am more than happy to suggest this product for small business or home use.
customer_reviews.author: The Patel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printing, and long-lasting toner
customer_reviews.text: I'm still on the cartridge of toner that came with the printer, but I don't use it every day, and only make a few copies when I do use it. It's great for printing off receipts, letters, and even photos, although in black and white they aren't good for much except to document something. They are a little dark, at times. The sleep function sometimes works, and sometimes doesn't. I'm not using it, because in sleep mode, it wakes itself up, anyway, or it won't wake up without a lot of messing with the settings. I had no trouble getting it to pair with my Mac in WiFi mode. The enclosed CD didn't work, but the online connection link did.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Kindwoman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home or small office.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this printer for more than 2 months. This is a great buy. This is an affordable laser printer for a small office set up. The cartridge that came with the printer printed about a 1000 pages.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: EASY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a brother printer before. Had no problems with it, but after reading reviews about how hard these are to set up, I was scared to try... But it was super easy. I followed the instructions slowly step by step and voila! I dit it! I initially couldn’t figure out how the password numbers could be entered on printer with no keypad, but found the up and down arrows scrolled through a numeric sequence and you tap ok when the right number comes up. I’ve attached the directions so you can see how easy it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Olson

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for a short time. Easy to set up and use. Didn't use it much. Then, after 6 months, it wouldn't turn on. There was no power. Went through all the steps. Unplugging, holding buttons down, removing tray and nothing worked. Just a useless large, heavy, expensive hunk of e-Waste that I now have to find a way to dispose of. Highly recommend you avoid this printer.
customer_reviews.author: William Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first cartridge replacement
customer_reviews.text: This product has a chip that you have to transfer from one toner cartridge to another. After using the cartridge that came with it, the generic cartridges that I bought would not work with this printer. I bought the cartridges from Amazon also. Do yourself a favor and make sure that the printer that you buy doesn't need you to transfer a chip from one toner cartridge to another. I would give this rating a zero, but that wasn't an option. I have always had good luck with Brother products until now, but I have ordered a Canon all in one as a replacement. We have had this Brother printer for less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a little larger and heavier than I expected (so be prepared)....but it was easy to set up (for those of us who aren't techies!!!) One caveat: the owner's manual that came with it was for the wrong model. However, it is online and can be found there and downloaded. Also, there is a separate download for scanning....but look for Brother IPrint&Scan in your programs, and it will walk you through it. One great function of the scanning: you can immediately name the document and drop it in the file you want in your computer rather than searching through dozens of downloads. I highly recommend this printer, copier, scanner. I've never had a Brother product that wasn't great...
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: It's the Cartridges, Stupid!
customer_reviews.text: The machine works fine, although the menus are counter-intuitive and a pain. For instance, it is not at all easy to go back and forth between setting the default from printing on both sides or only printing on one side. But if you are attracted to the cartridges for this machine which print 1,200 copies, beware! They are mis-represented. They only print only 300 - 400 copies which works out to about 14 cents per copy. Not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothea C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for its duplex printing. I have an old Brother HL-2170W still running strong. This printer is larger and bulky compared to the compact HL-2170W. The setup is a little confusing. Typing/entering Wifi key code is difficult. The printer has both wired and Wifi interfaces. But if Wifi is enabled, wired interface is disabled automatically. I already have HP scanners. But tried scanning of this printer and it works pretty good. I saw another Brother model of on sale for the same price that can fax as well. But this printer has ADF, the other one doesn't. I don't need fax capability anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne West

customer_reviews.title: Awesome multi functional printer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it about 1.5 years ago and very happy with it. Good quality, not very loud, decent scanner for office jobs. Works perfect via Wi-Fi with laptops on Windows 8 and Windows 10, even from another room. I bought it on promotion for $99.99 and it's a steal. Brother original toner is very expensive ($40+ for standard, about $70 for high yield), but there're plenty of aftermarket toner cartridges for $15-17 each (standard). If you can get it for under $150, don't hesitate and buy!
customer_reviews.author: V.S.Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Convenient wireless printing, doesn't always show up on devices
customer_reviews.text: Good value on an all in one laser printer/scanner. My only complaint is that it's annoying trying to print stuff on a mobile device if the printer hasn't been used recently. Printing off a desktop device works fine, but on a mobile device it says the "printer isn't available now" unless you physically go to the machine and wake it up from sleep, or print something from a desktop to wake it up. So, minus one star for inconvenient mobile printing. The printer itself works great.
customer_reviews.author: tightsandtea

customer_reviews.title: Love This Printer
customer_reviews.text: Decide to get something that doesn’t require 3-4 cartridges of colored ink, as in desk jets. I can live with black ink only to save $. Very easy to set up. Print quality in things like labels isn’t the greatest. But bought this at a very low price so happy enough. Scan works well. Can’t try fax as I haven’t figured out how to get that to work on any MFP with my “Ooma” phone set up (landline via computer). No problem with sleep mode. Love the double sided printing. Would highly recommend, just don’t expect the quality to be quite the same as a laser in the $1,000+ range.
customer_reviews.author: ErinH1

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for and works great. Driver install off the CD was easy and I am running Windows 10. I went with this type because I don't print alot of documents, but with my old ink jet, it never failed the ink was dried up. Got tired of wasting 15 bucks a pop to print a couple of things. This way there is no ink drying up, and should it run low, it will automatically order another cartridge. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jagjr67

customer_reviews.title: Brother Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer looks the same as the DCP-7065. I own and use both. The DCPL2550DW is not as well developed with regard to its firmware and software. This printer shuts down if not used and will not auto wake up like the 7065 does. Otherwise it looks and prints the same. I use both printers with Windows 7 and the drivers for the 2550 often crash. I know the 7065 is a bit more money but well worth the extra expense.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Olds

customer_reviews.title: Great home office printer, copier, scanner
customer_reviews.text: I put one of these everywhere I work, which means I have three of them. Great, simple wi-fi printer / scanner. Never had a connectivity issue on Windows 10 laptops. Lots of knock-off toner options out there help keep printing costs to a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: DeDub

customer_reviews.title: Gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few brother printers. My last one from 2006 finally gave up the ghost and I bought this one. The biggest problem is the scanner software. Like buying a printer from 1996. My 2006 Brother had an easy Mac interface that let you select part of the document and had lots of options. Brother's new Mac "iPrint&Scan" is a majorly scaled-down version. Only option- scan whole document. You would think the software would get better, not worse. This is devolution. I think I missed the window to return this multi-function printer. Can NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Whitener

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful all in one printer
customer_reviews.text: I like these, and have purchased 4-5 for different purposes. They work ok with cheap, generic toner for a very low cost per page for an inexpensive printer. Sometimes a little stubborn when setting up on WiFi. My son has one with a paper jam he can’t seem to clear, but all of the others have been great. I do wish it had a duplex doc feeder on the scanner to go with the duplex printing.
customer_reviews.author: i_reader

customer_reviews.title: Works unless you run Windows 10 S mode
customer_reviews.text: I ended up taking my new laptop out of S mode. If you want to print via network/wireless, you’ll need drivers. Since Brother does not have this in the Microsoft store, you can’t get it. Dropping S-Mode enables you to download what you want vice vetted applications. I, of course, am not familiar with whether or not other brands are in the same situation. I would recommend you check the Microsoft store if you’re running S-Mode prior to purchasing. It will work fine if you want to use a cord. You can certainly put this printer on your network, you just can’t use it without configuring on your machine.
customer_reviews.author: JIM

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of setup, but ultimately a great unit.
customer_reviews.text: I got this primarily for its scanner functionality. I like that the scanner is quiet, and so far the automatic document feeder works great, which is a real blessing. It's challenging to keep it in communication with my Mac - frequently I have to reboot both the Mac and the printer, so that's disappointing but also manageable. I had a lot of trouble initially with digital artifacts introduced in the scanning process (see attachment - image on left). This was using the standard Mac printer/scanner drivers - the problem went away when I installed the software & drivers from Brother, and scanned from their "iPrint & Scan" app rather than from my Mac Printer Control Panel.
customer_reviews.author: Apollo Grace

customer_reviews.title: Major issue for use with Macs -- no ICA support.
customer_reviews.text: I'd been successfully using the predecessor DCPL2540DW unit and bought this one for my wife thinking they would basically be the same. However this new DCPL2550DW doesn't support ICA protocol meaning that you can't scan using the macOS built-in software (Preview, Image Capture, Printers&Scanners Preferences), but must use the clumsy Brother software. Other than that, no issues. Stopping on "low" toner can be disabled from the control panel just like on my older printer, and for people who go with third party toner refills (I don't since we don't print much), plenty of them are available for this printer with reverse-engineered chips. This new printer also has a much easier to use ADF.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Almy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 other Brother printers so when I needed a new one I knew what many of the + and - of the brand were. This new printer has already surpassed the other 2 combined. The 2 sided printing is so wonderful for saving paper. The auto feed word nice and easy. The sleep mode and I have had some issues initially but it was more my wanting it to wake up and print fast. This printer is also quieter than my old ones so that is a nice thing as well. I'm so very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: ShaylynDev

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the worst I have experienced. I have printed fewer than 300 pages since owning it yet it has required me to change the “high yield” toner ($75 per cartridge) TWICE and the drum once. I have spent far more on toner for very few pages than on the printer itself. I have niticed here that I am not the only one to have experienced this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Seashore

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: Printer is a bit large and clunky compared to others. However in the current client where many of the printers available are overpriced or older models being dug out of stock rooms and sold for more than list price this is a pretty good value. Installation is straight forward and it seems to work well with Windows 10. The utilities provided with it are clunky and require far more interaction that they should but they do work. I was able to get this in a reasonable amount of time for a client whose printer had died. Last fall probably would have rated this printer three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: don’t worry about running out of ink
customer_reviews.text: i’d had it with inkjet printers. sure they’re cheap, but the ink cost is outrageous. a black & white copy on an inkjet actually uses the colored ink, too. since i’m not very concerned with colored copies, i’ve found this laser printer to be perfect. i’m not constantly wondering when the ink will run out, as the starter is supposed to print about 7,000 pages (what i was told). i’ve likely printed at least 100 pages since i got it (about1-1/2 months ago), and everything has been printing perfectly. and Brother’s customer care is excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: 4 months in and it's working great
customer_reviews.text: These are much better than the old gray models that could only print around 15 pages per minute. They've improved the printing speed so much it's really on par with the larger units. The only thing is the more expensive toner cartridges. Essentially you are looking at the same cost over the life of the printer as the larger models. This one is just cheaper up front.
customer_reviews.author: Dionisio L Yang

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you make lots of copies and just need black and white.
customer_reviews.text: I do love this printer as it prints copies quickly and clearly. Finally upgraded from a colored ink jet. I home school and needed a quick reliable printer. I decided to not do color as I rarely print in color. The only dislike that I did not realize when reading up on it is that it will not do automatic two-sided to two-side copies from the printer feeder. You have to use the scanner. It will however, do two-sided copies from PC and cell-phone.
customer_reviews.author: ledby1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value in a SOHO class laser printer under $200.
customer_reviews.text: Great example of a great laser printer! Priced right from Amazon, delivered way faster than promised! When ordered it was stated it would take two weeks to get it, and it was delivered 3 days later. My last Brother MFC Unit lasted about 20 years, and gave good print, copy, and scanner quality until it just died a few weeks ago. I have no doubt this one will work for years as well. For under $200 you can't go wrong, and since you can third party toner at less than a 1/3 the price of Brothers toner, it just looks like it will be tough to beat this primer. Do your self a favor, and get one.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel McRae

customer_reviews.title: I have yet to get it to print from my PC using WIFI. As such, virtually worthless.
customer_reviews.text: I have spent HOURS following procedures (steps 1 through 10 for "Need Help with Wireless Printing?" - 10 TIME CONSUMING steps, now that is a BIG reveal right there...), using Wizards, manually entering passwords using tedious 123abc input, retracing steps, resetting machine/PC/router, and attempting to print - only to get print from the IP address reports but nothing from my PC. Everything from the PC returns a print error.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Viverette

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, just awesome
customer_reviews.text: Day one....huge huge improvement over my 10-year-old HP, I didn't want to buy a new HP because of all their instant ink garbage and bad reviews. This brother's printer does everything I need it to do and is very easy to set up. 99% of time I only want black and white photos this thing is fast the toner doesn't dry up like traditional ink cartridges, and it's very fast and cheap toner. The scans are very clear and fast. I would definitely buy this again. Once I've had it a while if anything changes I'll update my review
customer_reviews.author: Goindef

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer Well Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: My old Brother printer has just retired after 8 years of excellent service. I purchased this new Brother printer. It is easy to install with the software disk provided. I got it synced with my laptop, my cell phone and two desktop computers. Printing is quiet, the speed is fast, and the printed documents are sharp and clear. It is a good printer at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Suibian

customer_reviews.title: Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: My household has gone through a lot of ink jet printers. We don't print very often but when we need to, we need to. Inkjets tend to dry out or gum up if you don't use them often and the ink if ridiculously expensive. Finally switched to this Brother laser a few years back and it's been perfect. Always works. Toner is expensive but it lasts forever so much cheaper than ink. We didn't really need to scan function but have ended up using it several times and it's great. You can even set up an app so you can print from your phone. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: E. Debris

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Printer on Market
customer_reviews.text: Trust me, I've bought every brand out there for my small office. This is by far the best for the $. Reliable, easy to use, fast, good quality, affordable. Don't waste your money on any thing else. I bought a second for my home.
customer_reviews.author: Citi-Zen

customer_reviews.title: Lied about Legal Size Paper
customer_reviews.text: The printer description says it has a paper tray that holds legal and letter size paper. That's true BUT the scanning and copying bed is only letter size so you can't scan or copy legal size documents. The write up needs to explicitly say that it can't scan or copy legal size documents. Instead it says it does a 'variety' of document sizes. This is my first Brother printer. I'm not a happy camper
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Ann

customer_reviews.title: NO DUPLEX, beware
customer_reviews.text: Despite the misleading advertising (some would say lies) this Brother printer/copier will NOT automatically duplex copy. You can copy from one-sided originals to 2 sided but you can spend hours trying to go from 2 sided to 2 sided. Wouldn't you say that is what "auto duplex" mans? After hours of frustration I contacted Brother. 3 days later i got this "...Please know that your Brother machine is not capable of making copies of both sides of the pages automatically, however your DCPL2550DW is capable of doing this manually." Since my 93 year old mother had already ordered extra toner, I may not send this back, but this first experience with Brother will be my last.
customer_reviews.author: chris w.

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer
customer_reviews.text: I use Linux O.S. Wanted to make the move away from inkjet. Only problem is that the brother Linux software and driver is (as usual) not as complete as the Brother Window's driver/software. Scanning with Linux is always problematic and Brother really does NOT supply a full featured driver and software package for Linux. The scanner still doesn't work for me under Linux. Had the same problem with a brother inkjet MFC. Why can't these printer manufacturers make a nice software and driver set for Linux? How hard could this be?
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Fast laser printer, scanner feeder...
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer, tired of my inkjet running through ink and slow print speeds. Sure thus is b&w only, but the ethernet connection to my network doesn't have the WiFi issues my last printer had. It spools up quickly and can do double sided printing. Document feeder works for scanning multi page documents, even color scans. Laser print doesn't water smear like inkjet. Most of what I print is b&w, still use my inkjet for photos, but this is so much better economically for 90% of my usage.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE K.

customer_reviews.title: UNCLEAN COPIES
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to make copies of coloring book pages on thicker paper for myself to color on with markers. Pages come out unclean almost looking like the image bleeds more down the page. We cleaned the inside of the printer and tried again and everything and am not sure what else to try. But I definitely feel like I've wasted my money
customer_reviews.author: Trish P

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my father in law (let’s be honest. My husband and I because we’re staying with him for a bit while we close on our home). We have a larger model of this printer and bought it to assist my FILs printing needs.
customer_reviews.author: TWOJ4

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Only had the printer a short time but it works well so far. Easy to connect to the wifi and print via phone or computer. Scanning to the computer has been a little trickier. I will update once I have to replace the toner or if an issue comes up but currently it’s working as well as I could hope.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, slight issue with paper output tray.
customer_reviews.text: Brought this to replace an old MFC7840 - the biggest difference between the two is this printer does not have a fax feature. Double sided printing is great. a few issues others have noted: 1 - Wi-Fi - no issue getting this working, just used the menu to setup the network and password. 2 - paper output is fiddly. Yes it is! the paper can get pushed into the unit and can be difficult to get out. The paper output tray is a big negative (hence 4 stars) but overall the machine works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: This Brother is the Cat's Meow!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is so easy to setup up, wireless and all. It's worked flawlessly for several months now. Not a single glitch or even a paper jam. It's fast. Has great scanning tools that you can run from your desktop. You can set up jobs to scan to your preferred outputs and at resolutions. In these jobs you can also specify an application for instance, certain things I like to scan directly into Evernote. I'll never go back to inkjet. I'v had HPs (bloated software, temptemental) and Epson Workforce all in one (eventually started crashing with error on every print). This Brother is the Cat's Meow!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Could not get Wi-Fi to work!
customer_reviews.text: It prints, copies and scans great for a multifunction machine under $100. Wasted three hours across two days with Brother technical support in India. They could not get the Wi-Fi to enable since the machine could not be found. So I hired a local computer guru at $75/hr. to get the Wi-Fi to work. Three hours later... no go. I then visited Walmart and bought a 10 ft. printer cable.....now it works like a champ. Thought about returning it and getting something else but it's not worth the hassle to repack it and haul it to UPS.....life's too short, I got better things to do. Maybe in hindsight I should have bought a Canon or HP
customer_reviews.author: Miami Machine

customer_reviews.title: Prints well
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of replacing the ink for inkjet printers and decided to spend a bit more on a printer. Don't use it often. Maybe once or twice a month? But it has been reliable and was very easy to install the necessary software. Honestly could probably just use it without the software as well.
customer_reviews.author: H.S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this like most of you Bc with the home school thing we need to print things. I deal with laser printers all day at work, so very familiar with what’s decent & what is cr@p... this falls into the decent home use category. If you’re getting it for this, good luck and get this printer. I opened up the front ports so you can see what’s inside, not broken. The printer behind it is my artisan photo high Det $$$ printer they were using to print out lessons for classes before I got this b&w printer 🙁
customer_reviews.author: Soomin Robert Kim

customer_reviews.title: No colored ink to replace
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an Epson wide format printer, that worked for about 2 years, that I could not get it to print. Plus the color cartrideges were expensive to replace. The machine quit printing because the printer heads quit working. My husband also had an Epson that didn't even last 2 years before it quit printing. This is a laser printer, only prints black, and the cartridge shouldn't have to be replaced as often. I gave up the color option for something that will not be considered a throwaway.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne G. Young

customer_reviews.title: WiFi connection only, can not plug into computer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this since March. Print quality is good, no complaints. The WiFi has had to be reconnected a few times and sometimes it works, sometimes not. Once was my fault (wrong password) . I did not realize i could not plug this machine into a usb port, which would be nice if the wifi is acting up. The ink cartridge says I am low on toner. I don't print 1200 pages in a year let alone 6 months, so wondering if this is a setting somewhere. I don't feel I can be out of ink already.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: rinter and Copier, DCPL2550DW
customer_reviews.text: I set it up it worked perfect for a while we had a power outage it went off line I set it up again never could get to work right it keeps saying to set up cloud account it is in the closet now I am using an Hp
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Sturgill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been top notch so far. It prints really fast and very clear text. It prints wirelessly from google docs without a problem. Even if I have not used it for days I can send a print from my phone and it connects and prints. I have read that people had a deep sleep issue but this one works great. I would suggest reading the instructions very clearly to set it up. The setup was a little tedious but once it was done it worked very well. If you are not techy get some help or even if you are get some help at the beginning. It can help allot with two heads instead of one.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: It pisses me off that things that were once standard features like an ethernet port and scan to network are now ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this laser printer because Brother informed me it had SMB and FTP abilities for scanning. You can enable disable the protocol from the web gui, but the printer does not actually support scanning for it. Ended up returning and getting a different printer. It pisses me off that things that were once standard features like an ethernet port and scan to network are now only in "higher end" $200+ business models. All I want is to be able to reliably print a document from time to time without clogged inkjet heads, and reliably scan (hence wired ethernet and not use their crappy scan-to-pc software that only finds the computer 50% of the time at best).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great on Fedora linux
customer_reviews.text: I used the shell script from Brother that then downloaded the two rpm files for printing and scanning. Printing = great Scanning = great Duplex printing = great I tested everything that I thought might have trouble when not using Windows/Mac, and it all tested out just fine. I got this printer due to having rather low printing needs and getting tired of trying to keep an inkjet working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime user

customer_reviews.title: Brother is the best
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer. I’ve had the canon pixima which was about $60 at the time I bought it, and the absolute worst printer ever made in my opinion from HP. This one is awesome. Easy set up, and easy printing from your computer or wireless device. Prints fast and nice and clear print. Haven’t tried customer support yet. None needed. Unlike the other 2 mentioned, it was a good hour or 2 right when I purchased them and tried to get them set up.
customer_reviews.author: intermediate player

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Received the MFC today. Setup was not the most straightforward I have ever done nor the worst. Tip: When entering the password for your wireless network work quickly. Mine seemed to time out while I was entering my long password. When finished typing the password, press the green button. I downloaded the app for Mac and it seems to work okay. I can print from my browser, scan documents and save to Mac and print from my iPhone. Copies and prints look very good. Hard to tell the copy from the original. Would buy again. Only unanswered question is durability. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C.

customer_reviews.title: Brother printers refuse to power up. Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Brother printers have a problem of just dying without warning. Google it and you’ll see. Just happened to me. And their tech support didn’t have ANY solution. Worst purchase ever.
customer_reviews.author: Anurag

customer_reviews.title: Linux Support!
customer_reviews.text: Prints well. Scans a bit hard to avoid loosing an edge. Duplex great. A bit hard to setup for Linux - had to work to track drivers and instructions. Not for faint of heart. Tech support got five stars because they found the Linux instructions for me.
customer_reviews.author: RWB

customer_reviews.title: wifi is buggy
customer_reviews.text: The WIFI connection is insanely buggy. Every time I need to print or scan, I have to restart first the computer then the printer for them to find each other, otherwise it won't find it and won't print or scan anything. I've searched online and this was the only solution I found that works, and even this is only a temporary solution, because every time I try to print this happens again. I have tried everything that I found in the various FAQs and I'm sure it's not just a router issue. For reference, my old wifi printer never had issues connecting to my router. Also, the scan quality is not impressive.
customer_reviews.author: tdl0

customer_reviews.title: Chronic problems
customer_reviews.text: Hate this printer. Keeps telling me to replace the drum. I just put a brand new one in and have 2 others not that old but still says replace drum. This thing is a PITA squared! Constantly loses connections to wifi devices. Need to reboot all the time. Ugh! Steer clear!
customer_reviews.author: kateinfl

customer_reviews.title: Flawless in all aspects
customer_reviews.text: Got to say, despite other reviews I had no trouble getting the printer to work in all aspects. The one thing I did do is logged the printer onto the wireless network before installing the software. As for the scanning to computer, I did download the app for MAC and setup the printer through it. Everything works great and no problem whatsoever with the deep sleep people were complaining about. As for print quality, I bought it mainly for text and I found it acceptable. I did print a couple g graphics as well and it is also acceptable
customer_reviews.author: RHart

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T print scanned legal size!
customer_reviews.text: It's an easy set up printer, prints beautiful black and white, BUT I can't have it print in legal size paper, which is the main reason I bought it for. As a loan signing agent I need a reliable printer & scanner, and I was hoping this brother copy/printer/scanner would do it... so far NO LEGAL SIZE PRINTING! If I can't have it to print my scanned documents any time soon I'll have to return before my return expires.(I'm still trying to make it work)
customer_reviews.author: Primavera

customer_reviews.title: whatever happened to plug and play
customer_reviews.text: unbelievably annoying set up, I usually never have any trouble setting things up but this is crazy, this is supposed to be a wireless printer but it seems to only to be able to find my roku devices everything else doesn't seem to exist in Brother world , maybe fresh eyes in the morning or a geek is needed. I"d us e a cable but even that isn't a stand USB on both ends.
customer_reviews.author: cc1980

customer_reviews.title: It pays for it's self
customer_reviews.text: Great printer if you do not nerd color for every thing this is the best for your money and if you do a lot of printing like i do this printer pays for it's self in 3 months with the ink you save. So glad my friend turned me on this type of printer instead of the cheap printers and then you pay 60.00 every month for a refill. I can go abot 4 to 5 months depending on how much printing I do. Save money never had a problem with off brand ink for around 25.00. You get 2 and this will last you about a year.
customer_reviews.author: T.J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect printer I needed
customer_reviews.text: The last printer I bought was almost 15 years ago because I printed my stuffs from work. I finally decided to purchase a new one for home. This one is perfect with decent price and product quality. Setup is easy. Been using it for some time now and I have not had any issues with it so far. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Edison Jiang

customer_reviews.title: Print speed and quality are excellent.
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a good printer. The initial setup was a little difficult. The instructions could have been a little better but I didn’t have any issues getting it set up. The key is to read ALL of the information and follow it to a “T”. Printer speed and quality are excellent. Also scanning works great. I use AirPrint quite a bit and it also works flawlessly. I would recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Piece of you know what
customer_reviews.text: Wow... I'm quite technical and this is a piece of crap. Wifi setup was impossible. Does not come with a direct cord to plug in with so you have to figure out the wifi set up... but you can't if the password doesn't work. At this point I just want to throw it in the trash. Oh of course the phone number doesn't work either and people aren't available. If you want to get an annoying product that actually is worse than older products then get this. They can't develop something better so they over complicate new products so they break or don't work. Way to go brother.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy WIRELESS set up!
customer_reviews.text: I am in no way tech savvy but I had no problem at all setting up this printer to Wifi! NO PROBLEM. I downloaded the set up app and it did the rest. I'm not a young person but did this one all by myself! It prints nicely, haven't had any jams, I love the option of top loading or drawer paper loading. Scans nicely too! I didn't have that deep sleep problem that I've read about. She wakes up just fine and quickly too whenever I need to print. So far no jams. This printer acts like the ones I used in my big office (before retirement) and it isn't a big beast.
customer_reviews.author: FitzGirl

customer_reviews.title: My Money Saver!
customer_reviews.text: After years of Ink Jet printers, this Brother Monochrome Laser Printer was my best decision! No more cloged pring heads, dried out ink cartridges! I use the scanner feature the most, and other laser printers would "dry up" seemingly when I needed to print. I have had this Brother Monochrome Laser Printer for over 18 months and still using the original print cartridge it came with. And of course, the scan feature is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Temkin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for students
customer_reviews.text: Thing is a monster. Already went through an odd 2000 pages this semester of random journals, handouts, PowerPoints, practice exams, etc. Never had any issues with print quality and no jams. Use laser paper and you'll be even happier. The aftermarket cartridges work and will save you loads.
customer_reviews.author: pkwolf55

customer_reviews.title: Set up is easy
customer_reviews.text: First of all Brother needs to rewrite the printer set up instructions. I tried following their instructions repeatedly with failure every time. Then I connected to my WiFi from my printer first. Then installed the software on my pc. That was so much easier and painless. This printer prints from my Android phone no problem. It might take a couple minutes to wake if up from sleep mode, but it does work. Remember you are printing directly from your phone to the printer. It does not go through your WiFi. Your signal might not be as strong. So far I am very happy with this printer and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With This Printer
customer_reviews.text: Startup is quick if a little noisy, but overall not bad. Toner use is very good and I get lots of use out of a cartridge. Print output is speedy enough and I have had no problems with the paper path in either the tray feed nor the document feeder.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER YOU WILL REGRET IT
customer_reviews.text: I was told this was a great printer however I have had NOTHING but problems with it. You cannot get it out of sleep mode UNLESS you unplug it and plug it back in. Therefore EVERY time you want to use it that is the SOP for use. What a waste of time. Then about every 5th time you print something it won't show up on the network at all. I have no patience for this kind of terrible interface. I should have purchased a Hewlett Packard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: This printer works great, and was easy to install on my ubuntu linux computer. Shortly after plugging it in, my computer gave me a popup offering to install the driver. It was up and running within moments! I also have a Windows computer for which installing the driver for the printer was actually a bit more complicated. I had to go to the brother website and download the software; it was easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Inkjet
customer_reviews.text: So far really happy with this printer. Finally made the switch from inkjet after years of headaches from depleted cartridges and mystery errors. This printer was super easy to set up right out of the box, and has worked great so far. User-friendly and easy to figure out the functions, prints quickly and great quality. No color option on this one but most of my printing is shipping labels so I don't mind. I appreciate the document feeder and scanner options as well.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up/Prints quickly - minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great printer/scanner. Very easy to install - had it up and running in a matter of minutes. My biggest complaint is that there's no pull out 'shelf' (for lack of better word) for paper to sit on when you manual feed. So the paper either hangs down or you have to hold it until it begins to print. This leads to the paper not always feeding in straight so sometimes the print is crooked. The other issue (which I didn't read for when buying) is it scans one sided only. I'm so used to scanners doing double side I didn't think to look for this feature. But overall nice printer.
customer_reviews.author: S Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: I feel like a boss using my professional office machine
customer_reviews.text: So glad I went with this. If you want to print labels or documents and dont care about pictures then thos is like having a professional office machine in your home. I feel like a big baller every time I use it to print my mercari labels. It connect direct to my galaxy. I never even tried on a network. Dont need to.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very happy with this purchase. It was very difficult to set the printer up and required downloading several apps to my computer for operation of the printer. Supported OS are only Windows and iOS, so if you have a Chromebook, you will not be able to set up the printer. Fortunately I also have a Windows computer. Still, I spent hours unsuccessfully trying to set up the scan to email functionality. Overall, the technology associated with this printer is pretty outdated. My previous HP was easy to set up and easily scanned to email. I only upgraded because I wanted the laser functionality. Looks like I should've stayed within the HP family.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Long

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and good quality
customer_reviews.text: HP does not support Color Laserjet 1600 on Windows 10. It happened when I just changed the new toner cartridges (I still have a set) unopen). Enen HP makes the good printer (and expensive toner cartridges). I decided to switch another brand. After study, I chose Brother DCPL2550DW. It is easy to setup for WiFi sharing with desktops and laptops in a house. Quiet Sleep mode and wakeup to print as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Multifunction Printer But Loud
customer_reviews.text: I was easy to setup this printer. If you bypass the extra software download it will be up and running in just a few minutes. It scans, copies and prints very well. But it is very loud - almost like a diesel truck starting up! If are using this in an office everyone will know when you use it. I have a Canon MFP in another office and one can barely tell when it is printing. This is not a truly multifunction device because it has no FAX. That is no issue with me because I have no land line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and manufactured product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought “used good condition” and it arrived without the toner drum. Amazon rectified the situation with their usual “make it right” great customer service. Great black and white copies. Does two sided printing well. This laser printer’s toner cartridge can freeze, unlike inkjet water-based cartridges, so perfect for our house here in Alaska, that we close up in the winter and allow to freeze.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Not too sure about the toner
customer_reviews.text: The only reason why I’m not giving it 5 stars is because I’m HIGHLY disappointed with the toner. It rubs off so incredibly easy. I’m still on the starter toner cartridge that came with the printer, but im still debating on whether I will purchase a Brother toner cartridge or not. I love the speed of the printer, although I wish the Brother scan/print application allowed you to edit the pdf more like my Canon allows.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: THESE ONLY LAST A YEAR
customer_reviews.text: After a year replace this unit, because it will inevitably say, can not recognize ink cartridge and that's the end of it. Period. Furthermore the feeder will not scan or print more than two or three pages before it starts pushing pages through and jamming them. Scan fails about 25% of the time. Works OK as a 80 dollar printer, problem is it's a 300 dollar printer / scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Chan Man

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, but beware of toner scams
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up and works well with all our devices (including phones!). However, Brother will try to rip you off with their low toner warning and their toner microchips. I got about 1000 pages out of the original toner cartridge after the printer tried to make me replace it (had to change the settings to keep printing at all). I also had to search a while to find a cheap toner cartridge that the printer would accept.
customer_reviews.author: Rossman C. Palfrey

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine. My daughter uses one and loves it so I bought one also.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has had one for a few years and loves hers, so I bought one to save money on ink. It works just fine, is easy to set up and I didn't need the tech support since my kid is a puter geek.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: wish we would have got this long ago
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo glad we finally gave up on the stupid ink jet pieces of garbage. This thing works awesome. press print and you instantly have your perfectly printed paper, no waiting for the inkjet to make a bunch of noise and then spit out something half printed or smeared.
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Good printer works in ubuntu including scanning. Could have got the better model at samsclub for the same price. I almost returned due to that fact. I just needed it right away. Also for those printing more than 1 rem of paper get ready to change the tone as I have printed 200 simple pages and I'm almost half way through it yes I'm using toner saver eco mode etc.
customer_reviews.author: AsWangs

customer_reviews.title: Good printer...toner yield half of what is promised!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer; however, the toner yield is approximately half of what is promised. I am on my third TN-730 toner now and each time I am able to print around 600 pages when the promised yield is 1200. I spoke to Brother customer service and they were little to no help. They did inform me that once the printer says to replace the toner and stops printing, you can place the printer in "Continue" mode so it will keep printing until the toner is completely out even if the quality is lower. Again, I purchased this product based largely on the expected cost and yield of the toner and have been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: The 4th Musketeer

customer_reviews.title: A most have no fax and it is perfect :) I like it clean :)
customer_reviews.text: I don’t need a fax All in one to me is print, copy and scan :) I love it :)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Donoghue

customer_reviews.title: Superior cost saving
customer_reviews.text: I used a Canon 9120 for office printing before this Brother printer. Let me tell you, this printer is easily one of the best deal for office printing. The stupid canon would eat so much ink that about 50 pages of black and white printing would cost this brother printer itself. And I'm using the cheapest offbrand ink carts too. Not to mention the much greater print quality the laser printer provides.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Replaced our 11-year old Brother and love it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both have Apple/Mac laptops and this printer works great for us. I'm leading with that since we almost didn't get it because of a couple of other negative reviews from Mac users, but it was easy to set up and works great. I suppose a caveat is that we're using it wirelessly, so maybe the other users had problems with their direct connections. Anyway, it's working great, and we're looking to get a good long life out of it like we did our old one (RIP, dear printer, that moved back and forth across country with me twice!).
customer_reviews.author: M. Zampino

customer_reviews.title: Good - laser printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product during thanks giving deal, main prupose is , scanning documents through document feeder and also print some home work sheets for my 3rd grade kid for practise. and print some kids painting diagram to engage my 4 years old kid. this printer is doing great, it is wireless and wired both. I am using wireless. we can scan and send the document from the printer and send the document to a laptop which is connected to the wifi. overall, good budget laser printer, worth it for the money and my use.
customer_reviews.author: Mira

customer_reviews.title: Bricked
customer_reviews.text: ZERO STARS Get the printer setup. Print 1 test page. Test page looks great! Informed I need to update firmware. Allow the firmware process to proceed and do not mess with the power button or the power in the house. Firmware update stops at 90% and says to try again. Printer wont turn on. Bricked. 100 dollars wasted.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Great printer with easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Great compact printer. It was easy to set up, I just simply followed the quick setup instructions. Did not have to complete the set up on my computer. I was able to easily connect to the printer to Internet following the directions. I did however follow the directions that someone else posted here on disabling the deep sleep option. Other than that the printer works great with my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: H. Velador

product_meta.title: Brother Monochrome Laser Printer, Compact Multifunction Printer and Copier, DCPL2550DW, Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready, Black
product_meta.description:
Style:New Model: DCPL2550DW

The Brother DCP L2550DW is the ideal choice for the busy home or small office looking for a fast, reliable multi function copier. A replacement for the dependable DCP L2540DW, this new and improved multiple use copier includes a 50 sheet automatic document feeder, which allows multi page copying and scanning, and class leading print speeds of up to 36 pages per minute for increased efficiency. This printer and copier has a reliable Wi Fi connection, which allows printing from wireless devices including desktops, smartphones, laptops, and tablets. For those who prefer hardwire connections, there’s an Ethernet interface for sharing with multiple users on your network. You can also connect locally to a single computer via USB interface. Operating Environment: Temperature 50-91°F.

Speed and efficiency are trademarks of the new Brother DCP L2550DW multi purpose digital copier. The 250 sheet paper tray handles letter and legal sized paper, reducing the need for refills. Automatic duplex (2 sided) printing also saves paper and creates professional looking documents for presentations, newsletters, and other common office needs. Help to save money by using Brother Genuine high yield replacement cartridges (TN 760), which are available through Amazon (also compatible with TN 730 replacement toner cartridge).

The Brother Digital Multi Purpose Copier comes with a one year limited warranty and free at your side support, online or via phone or live chat, for the life of your printer. At Brother, we want to ensure that your experience with us is exceptional. If your home or small office is looking for an efficient and user friendly digital copier, add the Brother DCP L2550DW to your Amazon shopping cart today.

(1) Based on competing in class monochrome laser multifunction printers under 300 dollars. Print speed specifications gathered from manufacturer websites as of 1/9/2017.(2) Requires connection to a wireless network.(3) TN 760 High Yield vs. TN 730 Standard Yield. Up to two times more prints and lower printing costs based on yields and MSRP. Standard Yield and High yield cartridges sold separately.(4) Approx. toner cartridge yield in accordance with ISO/IEC 19752 (letter/A4).(5) Reprinted from PCMag with permission. Copyright 2017 Ziff Davis, LLC. All Rights Reserved.(6) Approx. 300 pages per month in accordance with ISO/IEC 19752 (Letter/A4) using the 2 toners provided in box.(7) The mobile device must have NFC capability and run Android OS 4.4 or later.
feature_bullets: Print more, wait less. Engineered for increased efficiency with class leading Print speeds of up to 36 pages per minute.
Dynamic features meet your evolving needs. The 250-sheet paper capacity helps improve efficiency with less refills and handles letter and legal sized paper.
Flexible printing. The manual feed slot offers flexible paper handling of a variety of papers and sizes including card stock, envelopes, etc. To help you create Professional looking documents.
Engineered to deliver productivity. Up to 50-sheet automatic document feeder helps save time with multi-page copy & scan.
Printing as mobile as you are. Print wirelessly from your desktop, laptop, smartphone and tablet.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,018 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
